abstract: Now that InBev has clinched its $52 billion deal to buy Anheuser-Busch, several side issues need to be hashed out. One is which assets InBev will sell to help pay for the deal. (So long, Sea World?) Another is what Grupo Modelo, the Mexico-based maker of Corona beer that is half-owned by Anheuser, has up its sleeve.
lead_paragraph: Now that InBev has clinched its $52 billion deal to buy Anheuser-Busch, several side issues need to be hashed out. One is which assets InBev will sell to help pay for the deal. (So long, Sea World?) Another is what Grupo Modelo, the Mexico-based maker of Corona beer that is half-owned by Anheuser, has up its sleeve.
